channel.title: Changing What an items worth it called
channel.description:
Ok guys, im having a bit trouble here. My pk points shop have items that you exchange points for, but when you click the item to see the value it says 100 Coins but it actually costs 100 PK Points. and i was wondering if anyone can help me change what its called when you check the Value that would be great!
Thank you, Iamapker

item.title: Changing What an items worth it called
item.dc:creator: @wohuynia wohuynia
item.description:
@wohuynia wrote:

[quote=“iamapker, post:3, topic:335907”]ok heres the whole code of the thing when i add your thing

}<---------------------------- LOL if (MyShopID == 47) { sM(getItemName(removeID)+": currently costs "+ShopValue+" Pk points"+ShopAdd); } if (pkPoints >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0){ pkPoints -= TotPrice2; addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sM("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sM("Not enough PK points for this item."); } }

Please help[/quote]
Lol failed code

Read full topic
item.source: Changing What an items worth it called

item.title: Changing What an items worth it called
item.dc:creator: @InfeRnaL_One InfeRnaL One
item.description:
@InfeRnaL_One wrote:

	if (MyShopID == 47) {
	    if (pkpoints >= TotPrice2) {
		if (freeSlots() > 0){
		   pkpoints -= TotPrice2;
                        addItem(itemID, 1);
                        server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
                        server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
                        if ((fromSlot + 1)
                                > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
                            server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
                        }
                    } else {
                        sM("Not enough space in your inventory.");
                        break;
                    }
                } else {
                    sM("Not enough PK points for this item.");
                }
        	}

Use that that will work

item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

ok heres the whole code of the thing when i add your thing

} if (MyShopID == 47) { sM(getItemName(removeID)+": currently costs "+ShopValue+" Pk points"+ShopAdd); } if (pkPoints >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0){ pkPoints -= TotPrice2; addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sM("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sM("Not enough PK points for this item."); } }

item.source: Changing What an items worth it called

item.title: Changing What an items worth it called
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

I’ll try my best to help you, I think I have a solution.

Step One:
Open your Shops.cfg, and find the Shop ID of your PK shop.

Step Two:
Once you have found your Shop ID, open up client, and search for the following:

					if (MyShopID ==

Step Five:
Add the following code under your search result:
if (MyShopID == --) {
sM(getItemName(removeID)+": currently costs “+ShopValue+” Pk points"+ShopAdd);
}
NOTE: REPLACE THE ‘–’ TO YOUR SHOP ID.

Step Six:
Save, and compile, and you’re done!

Best of luck.

  • Jackson.

Read full topic
